result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A Taper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with credit of 84 days time served.
Probation to be served under Act 100.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation.Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No contact with JLB.

- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Court referred defendant to Swaggert House on Fond du Lac Avenue.

- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Random UA's.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A Taper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon A Taper in court with attorney Amanda Kremer for Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Brandon A Taper in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom.
BRANCH 1 FOR BRANCH 30.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS CONCURRENT, in the House of Correction, credit of 84 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.

- Probation to be served under Act 100.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Random UA's.
- No dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- No contact with JLB.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Court referred defendant to Swaggert House on Fond du Lac Avenue.

Attorney Amanda R. Kremer in court on behalf of Attorney Allison Ritter, defendant Brandon A Taper not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defendant was not produced for today's hearing, Defense requests an adjournment. 
Court grants adjournment. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court on behalf of Allison Ritter, defendant Brandon A Taper not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  
Case in Court for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30. Plea/sentencing hearing is scheduled on May 23, 2022 at 11:00am.

Attorney Amanda Kremer appears for Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Brandon A Taper not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record, defense asks for an adjourned plea and sentencing date. State does not object. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Amanda R. Kremer in court, defendant Brandon A Taper not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant was produced for an inperson hearing.  However, Court was by zoom only and is unable to proceed.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction, filed.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Brandon A Taper not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Defendant's parents JLB and JB, or their residence
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Brandon A Taper in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Brandon A Taper in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon A Taper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
